UIC’s Department of Bioengineering offers master of science degrees in bioengineering and bioinformatics .  Within each degree program, students can choose between a thesis track (ideal for students who may want to continue on for a PhD after completing the master’s) and a non-thesis track.  A master’s degree in bioengineering from UIC prepares you for a wide range of career paths in the biomedical field, including:   Researchers in academic, industry, or government laboratories  Researchers in medical schools and hospitals  Research and development positions at companies  Entrepreneurship in bioengineering   Get acquainted with UIC’s master’s degree offerings in bioengineering and bioinformatics in our MS programs overview booklet (PDF) .      degrees        MS in Bioengineering          MS in Bioinformatics          Considering study at UIC?
